SENT.plain: Between 1994 and 2011, we performed 133 Fontan conversions with arrhythmia surgery
Most patients had tricuspid atresia or double-inlet left ventricle with prior atriopulmonary connection
Operative mortality was 1.5%, and mean length of stay was 14 days
A total of eight patients (6%) have had late cardiac transplantation
Freedom from arrhythmia recurrence is 85% at 10 years

For properly selected patients with a functionally univentricular heart who have had an atriopulmonary Fontan procedure, Fontan conversion with arrhythmia surgery significantly improves quality of life
